reviews.title: Great solo or with a group
text: I've been solo and with friends and have had a great experience both times! The weekend and evenings are definitely busier, but my weekday trip was ideal. The food is also excellent!
Go Place is spotless and the staff are polite even with not so polite patrons.  Come with the right attitude and stay long enough to get your money's worth.

reviews.title: Relaxing but...
text: Good place only downside is if you go as a couple you can't enjoy the water therapies together, they are on the menu and woman's side separately

reviews.title: Spa in a Strip Mall
text: I had reviewed previous comments and was aware of what to expect.  The check in process was easy - bring photo ID.  We then took the escalator up to the top, where there is shoe locker (unlocked) to correspond with the number on your wrist band.  You then make your way to the change room, where the front desk hands out either short sets or a robe.  For the jacuzzi area (divided), you can wear a bathing suit.  The water was warm and lots of space to sit and hang out with friends.  The steam room was always full.  Massages take place on the upper level and then facility is clean and well organized.  I had a hot rock massage and it was a fun experience.  Back on the main level, we tried the Salt Room, Jade Room, Volcanic Room and Cold Room.  There are beds throughout including Infa Red and there are lounging and areas to play board games.  The restaurant was great.  The food was yummy.  Great selection.  The only negatives - the change room itself is small and not private.  Otherwise, staff and cleanliness were great.  We were there fore over 7 hours and the tie flew.  Would definitely good back.  The parking is also challenging, as the Spa is located in a strip mall with a grocery store beside it.  Super busy.  You cannot bring flip flops - you must puchase from the front desk.  That's it.  Have fun!

reviews.title: Fantastic place to relax and recharge
text: This is place is amazing. I went back twice in the past three months. It offers  relaxation, tranquility and comfort. The place is very well maintained, rules are enforced and I love that as it means hygiene and cleanliness are also maintained. It is a very elegant and clean place. The staff work hard to keep the place clean and looking beautiful. There are four saunas and an ice/cold room. The hot tubs are fantastic however are separate in men's and women's change rooms. The food at the restaurant is very good. I had two meals there and was never disappointed. I'd recommend going mid week as it gets busy on weekends. I went with friends and my husband and they all loved it. We can't wait to go back.

reviews.title: The best Spa in GTA Toronto
text: Highly recommend this place.  The whole atmosphere is relax, comfortable.  Staff is all over the place waiting to serve you.  All saunas are above average.  Love the Amethyst room where you can just lye down and relax.  All lounge chairs are comfortable, better than my bed.  Jacuzzis have the right temperature.  The whole place is clean.  They have good quality shampoos and cream. The food is out of this world.  Every dish we ordered are amazingly delicious.  Prices are very reasonable.  What I like the most, you don't need to book to go, except if you are having a massage.

reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing day spa.
text: I’m glad that I didn’t listen to the reviews. This place is clean, beautiful and calls for a relaxing time. We had a nice meal in the restaurant. The sushi, dumplings and miso soup were delicious. This place is not cheap but if you spend several hours there. My only complaint is that they don’t have enough red light lounges. Please rarely get up to let others use them. We loved the volcanic room and the round sauna rooms. Next time I will bring flip flops for the shower. I’ve heard so much about this place and I’m glad we gave it a try. A very relaxing day at the spa with spouse, or friends.

reviews.title: In need of a Break
text: Check-in was easy  - staff very helpful - especially if it is your first time
Thank God for an escalator to go up - 3 levels of stairs would be a workout on its own; however going down is only stairs (from what I saw)
It was late afternoon on a Friday - 4 pm when I arrived -  I expected it to be super busy but it was not that bad. It got less busy by like 7 pm
Guests need to be reminded that constant talking inside the various rooms is a turn-off - people need to respect the process.
Few things to bring: a bag for your stuff like i-pad/charger etc. head piece (not everyone wants to hear your stuff)
Food: was good; reasonably priced and good quantity for one
Was a great experience - definitely planning on going back

reviews.title: A great indoor SPA experience
text: Spend a full day to pamper yourself to rest and relaxation. At check-in, they will provide you with a rubber bracelet with a number which is used to purchase food or items and lock your locker by tapping. There are filtered water stations throughout the spa. They will provide you with shorts and a top. Do not bring plastic water bottle or your own slippers unless they are white. They will give you white socks if you do not have slippers to walk around in certain areas or you can purchase slippers for $3.50 in your change room. I would recommend attending during the weekday when it is not too busy because of wait times to access the therapy rooms.  There are all toiletries in the change room if needed. i.e shampoo, soap, conditioner, toothpaste, mouth wash toothbrush etc... Note: The lockers are very close together so you might find there is not much room to navigate if there is someone else trying to retrieve their personals from their locker. Also the high pressure showers are too close to the Jacuzzi's which splash all over the Jacuzzi's. Some therapy rooms are hot so you can lock your phone and ear pods by tapping the lock box using your rubber bracelet. Overall it was a a good experience.

reviews.title: The phone# is a long distance call
text: It is very hard to get someone to answer their phone, I tried to call to get some inquiries but keep calling for a couple of days, and no one answers. Then I noticed I got charged long distance for calling them, because each time no one answer, it goes to their auto message to tell you to call again. They are located in Markham but they have an Oshawa number, I called from my Toronto phone and got charge long distance so many times, what a scam.

reviews.title: BE CAREFUL ABOUT HIDDEN FEES!
text: 1. I was charged an extra $100 which the receptionist didn’t even mention for failing to return a card game (which obviously I did, it was a $10 card game, I have no reason to steal it) and the receptionist was very rude and blamed me when I pointed it out.

2. This is the only place I’ve ever been to that requires you to pay a 12% service fee on your entire bill AND asks for a tip on top of that. What is the service fee then? Shouldn’t that be included in the admission price?
3. Masseuse finished at the designated end time even though she was late and did not offer any extension or explanation

reviews.title: 4 hour waitlist…
text: This spa needs to hire a new head of operations, as they are exploiting their customers to maximize general admission profits. We made appointments for 6pm and were told upon arrival that we would be added to a waitlist. After waiting for an hour, we were then told that we wouldn’t be let in until 5pm. Note that their confirmation emails say that they strongly advise to arrive AT LEAST 1 hour for the facilities which are an additional, mandatory cost. They were taking people on a waitlist that was 3-4 hours long. They should not be accepting people on a waitlist if the customers who made appointments can’t even be let in because they have already reached capacity. This is unethical and inconsiderate to everyone’s time. You either operate with an appointment system or a waitlist system - if you apply both, this needs to be done properly.

reviews.title: A whole day of relaxation
text: We went there to celebrate my partner's birthday and we had an amazing time. It is a very affordable way to disconnect from the busy routine we are used to. It is very easy to spend the whole day resting inside the go spa. It has all you need to relax and unplug.

You can fin different staces to rest, the series of saunas is amazing and the restaurant (which is open till 2 am) is great. Only down side could be that the jacuzzis are separate for men and women as they are located inside the changerooms.
I found the place to be very clean and the staff friendly.
Overall we had a great time and I definitely recommend you all to visit the GO spa if you can.

reviews.title: To crowded to relax here!!! ✌️😎✌️
text: Nice Spa!!! 😎🍸😎

This spa is in the plaza near the Chinese supermarket, you would think what the heck of this spa doing in the middle of the plaza next to a Chinese grocery. But, I was surprised, I shocked actually because for when you go inside is a totally different world than outside, interior & exterior does not match at all. Anyways, “ the GOOD”, the spa is massive, the flooring is heated, the locker rooms are great, the bracelet that they give you in checking in is the key to your locker & for everything else ( food, drinks, massage & facial), you don’t have to pay for when you check in, you pay for when you checked out (believe me the expenses adds up for when you check out), the baths are good, the steam room is good too, the showers are great & the products they used is “ L’Occitane” for shampoo, conditioner & body wash, they used Dyson hairdryer which is actually really good same goes with L’Occitane, I posses one of my own, so I could actually comment on that. They have 6 hot sauna & 1 cold ones, sports bar & gym together in one room, computer & consoles, yoga rooms, UV ray beds, dark rooms, restaurant that serves breakfast, lunch & drinks, the restaurant also serves drinks; fruit juice, pops, bubbas but no alcoholic drinks. Overall it was a great place to chill & hang out with family & friends. I give this place a 4 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ because the manager & the staff needs to control the noises of the people that checking in here, it’s becoming stagnant & you can’t even find tranquility because of that. So, 4⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️.

reviews.title: Must go early to experience the tranquility
text: Participated in a day at the spa with my spouse in December 2021. I booked my massage 1 month in advance of my scheduled date/time and was able to get two females registered massage therapist for our deep tissue 1 hour massage. We arrived early to partake in the various rooms prior to our scheduled 11 am massage. I would say the massage was great however i felt very rushed after the appointment to leave the room ..i guess they required to clean it and prep for the next client. It would be nice to get a buffer at least 5-10 minutes after the massage to get acclimated to the "real world" again. All locations were very clean and i felt very relaxed. The food/cafeteria area was also enjoyable. I will say right about 2 pm is when it became very loud. It is always best to either go really early or pay the premium to come in a little later a night for the peace and tranquil experience. I look forward to returning soon!

reviews.title: Over priced
text: This place is very over rated. $65 entrance fee even when you have a massage or service booked. We did not care to use the amenities, was given a gift certificate and wanted a massage only...which was mediocre at best.
If you want a good spa experience, you may as well spend the money on a good where amenities are included with the service booking.

reviews.title: Disappointing
text: If you are the person that doesn’t need any massage services this is a place for you.

The place is massive and nice but that’s all about it. When it comes to massage services they lack to that area.  They can’t even provide 2 female masseuse for couple.  They will provide you 1 female and 1 male even you had advised them on the phone and specifically requested it. When you arrived the place that’s the only way you’ll find it. And they will tell you don’t have to or can cancel while you had already driven so far. They don’t really care as they know you don’t have a choice.  They also don’t have a make it right policy in place and don’t think have manager I’ve tried asking for one but they said there is no one.  I’ve been here for 3x giving them chance to make things right but always get disappointed.   Hope this experienced of mine won’t happen to anyone else. I didn’t feel any appreciation as a regular customer at this place at all.

reviews.title: Spectacular spa in Markham
text: Love love love this place. I have already booked to go back. There are so many things to do. We got there 2 hours before our massages and facials were to start and with a quick dinner felt we ran out of time. So many rooms - for us we visited later on a weekday so most we empty. Loved the massage, probably one of the best I’ve had. Everyone is so friendly and helpful it really feels like you are being pampered from the moment you step it. Because I can spend just by blinking my time there was about $300 which included the admission fee and a one hour RMT massage plus $3 for slippers (I was treated to dinner by my friend). Going back on the weekend and again in December. Looking forward to this being a regular self-care treat.

reviews.title: Nice place 🤠
text: A nice place to have a decent massage. The price reflects the perfect facility and super nice therapist.

reviews.title: Amazing experience
text: We visited for the first time in February, and it was wonderful! We spent about 4 1/2 hours there, including a 60 minute massage (one of the best massages I've had, too). We tried the different sauna rooms, and liked the variety they offered, including the Ice Room, perfect, for reseting our temperatures after trying some of the hotter rooms. Loved that there was lots of seating available for lounging, and that there are lockable storage units for phones when going into the sauna rooms. Also enjoyed the green juice I got from the restaurant area. Next time, I'd bring a card game to play to take advantage of the tables in the lounge areas.

reviews.title: Did not honour gift card
text: Claimed a PIN was needed but there emails with the gift card have no pin. Have to file credit card dispute

reviews.title: Poor
text: Poor customer service and terrible  management ! Would not recommend to anyone who wants to be treated nicely and professionally

reviews.title: terrible booking system; not worth the hassle
text: frustrating and disappointing booking service. Calling me back days later to say no rmt available and other services have only late timeslots is useless; not to mention it's impossible to get through on the phone.

reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
text: I saw this place on Google and decided to come and check it out, and I wish I never did.
Oh my god, this place is terrible! They do not clean the mats in the sauna rooms, literally can see someone's sweat on the mat as if it were a chalk outline at a crime scene. DISGUSTING!!!

Zero consideration into hygiene, I see staff touching random things, changing towels and then proceeds to serve food and drinks! THAT'S GROSS... I'M LITERALLY PUTTING MY MOUTH ONTO SOMEONE ELSE'S SWEAT AND SKIN CELLS!

Feels like everyone here including the staff are zombies, no one is friendly and everyone seems sick of their job. The robot cat that roams around has more personality than the staff here, though, I cannot blame them, they were probably trained to be mindless drones.

Food is comparable to First Markham Place food court but with a hefty price increase. Don't waste your money here. Drinks are terrible as they are bland. Food is literally just overpriced mall food court food. The lobsters are tiny and a rip-off (better off going to Fishman's if you want to get lobster) Drinks are again overpriced for a garbage smoothie or shake.
Mediocre massages from upstairs for $150+. RMTs here love to give you dirty looks and rude attitude.

To sum it up, just don't bother coming to this greedy place just to feel ripped off and down after. You're better off taking the money that you spend here and just buying yourself or your family a nice dinner.

reviews.title: Amazing time
text: We went for a birthday and had all ages from 13-70. Everyone enjoyed the food, the spas, the saunas, and the massage/facial services. People are very nice and helpful. Lots of opportunity to relax as well including a nap room. Would recommend this place to go relax and enjoy.

reviews.title: Terrible
text: This place is like a busy Starbucks. Why do you call it spa, I don’t know. Massages are mediocre, so as everything else. Just a lot of people lounging, and walking, saunas are very busy. Total experience is not even one star. Waist of an evening. Agree with previous reviews, the plastic outfits and experience is like you are in some sort of factory facility.

reviews.title: Anything but not SPA
text: There is terrible synthetic wearing required by spa. It is absolutely uncomfortable and unhealthy experience to wear this environmentally unfriendly costume! The place is extremely busy, nothing to do with relax atmosphere. A lot of enological  rules and requirements. Very tight change rooms. Overall overpriced place managed by people why just all about making money, nothing about relaxation. Don’t waist your time and money.

reviews.title: Never visit on a weekend
text: My first visit, on a weekday, was much better.

The weekend visit was full of large crowds, kids everywhere, a long wait for every facility, tons of people chit chatting and taking pictures every ten steps. It fee like you’re in a crowded shopping mall. Anything but relaxing.
The only reason I didn’t rate the experience lower is because the massage and facial were good — those treatments were only the only opportunities for true relaxation.

reviews.title: This is not for couples!
text: This is not for couples! Since jacuzzi area for male and female are separated,. This was huge dissapointment, we were planing ti spend night in jacuzzi together and they separated us, at the entrance I spent my night alone.

reviews.title: Men’s spa done
text: They switched the men’s spa area to women’s.  That is terrible.  The men’s hot tubs are reduced to 70% less.  You are now almost hugging other men in the spa area.   Don’t go along or group men and bro time.  Only ok to bring the gf or wife now.
So disappointing!
